name: Paul Newman Crab Salad
author: lastMNcook
summary: I invented this simple pasta salad about ten years ago, and my son requests it as his birthday meal ever since. It's always a hit at potluck dinners and tailgate parties. The trick to make it taste fresh is to dress shortly before serving. The extra dressing in the bottle can be used the next day if there are leftovers to freshen the taste. My son likes the leftovers, but I think it tastes best the day it is made.
ingredients: 1 cup frozen petite peas, or more to taste
½ cup grated Parmesan cheese, or more to taste
⅔ (8 ounce) bottle bottled oil and vinegar salad dressing (such as Newman's Own®), or to taste
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook rotini at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes
Put frozen peas into a large colander
Fill the now-empty pot with cold water
Plunge pasta and peas into the cold water to chill completely; drain
Mix imitation crabmeat, Swiss cheese, and parmesan cheese in a large bowl; add pasta mixture and toss to mix
Pour dressing over the salad and toss to lightly coat
